title: $1 million quake fund ok'd
author: Ap
text: Major-league baseball owners have agreed to set up a fund to help victims of the earthquake that devastated Northern California last week, New York Yankees owner George Steinbrenner told a Toledo television station yesterday        Steinbrenner told WTOL the 26 teams will contribute $40,000 each, or $1.04 million, to the Red Cross to help victims.        ``They (owners) are going to make a sizable contribution to the San Francisco Bay area . . . which we should do. I think this is something that all Americans should care deeply about and should get involved,'' Steinbrenner said after attending a funeral for a Toledo labor leader.        ``And I compliment Commissioner Fay Vincent on what he's done. I think it is a magnificent gesture.'
